song.title: It’s Good To Be Me!
song.author: Mark and Helen Johnson
song.summary: A feel-good, fun and contagious song in a soft-rock style, this is destined to become an invaluable teaching tool and a firm favourite – it’s a real Mark and Helen classic! It tackles crucial issues of self-acceptance and avoiding comparisons. The song concludes with the verse and chorus sung at the same time: ‘It’s great to be different but together!’
song.teachingTips:
• Watch the rising pitch in the verses on the words ‘together’ and ‘wherever’ to make sure that everyone is using their listening skills to hit the right notes accurately.
  • When learning the song add some claps during the rests in the chorus such as: ‘But if I try (clap, clap) to compare myself with you (clap, clap)’ and ‘I’ll never see (clap, clap)’. Then, take the claps away and get the children to use their ‘thinking voices’ instead.
  • There are some fantastic syncopated rhythms in both the verse and the chorus that sound great when sung crisply, especially when the chorus and verse are sung together at the end. Get the children to really accentuate those offbeat rhythms and use their bodies to get into the groove.

assembly.title: The Lead-up to Leaving Pack
assembly.description: Three teacher-led assemblies, designed to be delivered in the weeks leading up to the end of term.

assembly.title: Remember & Celebrate!
assembly.description: A celebratory assembly that offers opportunities for the leaving children to share, and hold on to, memories of their time at primary school.

assemblyPlans.name: Assembly 1 (The ‘It’s Good To Be Me’ Pack)

assembly.title: The ‘It’s Good To Be Me’ Pack
assembly.description: These FIVE assemblies celebrate the wonder of being human and the value of being ‘me’. Based on the animation above and the song below, the assemblies unpack themes such as understanding that God sees our potential, looking beyond appearances and learning to be a good role model.

phrases.content: It’s great to be<large> different but together.</large>
I’m<large> happy</large> to be the <large>‘me’ I am!</large>
It’s great to be<large> different but together.</large>
I’m <large>happy</large> to be the <large>‘me’ I am!</large>
But if I try to<large> compare myself</large> with <large>you</large>
That make me the <large>‘me’ I am!</large>
But if I try to<large> compare myself</large> with <large>you</large>
That make me the <large>‘me’ I am!</large>
I’m free to be <large>who I am wherever.</large>
I’m <large>happy</large> to be the <large>‘me’ I am!</large>
But if I try to<large> compare myself</large> with <large>you</large>
That make me the <large>‘me’ I am!</large>
It’s great to be <large>different but together.</large>
I’m <large>happy</large> to be the <large>‘me’ I am!</large>
But if I try to <large>compare myself</large> with <large>you</large>
And all the<large> things you do,</large>
That make me the <large>‘me’ I am!</large>
But if I try to <large>compare myself</large> with <large>you</large>
And all the<large> things you do,</large>
That make me the <large>‘me’ I am!</large>
I’m free to be <large>who I am wherever.</large>
I’m <large>happy</large> to be the <large>‘me’ I am!</large>
I’m free to be <large>who I am wherever.</large>
I’m <large>happy</large> to be the <large>‘me’ I am!</large>

resources.title: Use Lyrical Phrases And Dynamics With Call-And-Response Rhythms
resources.privateTitle: Use Lyrical Phrases And Dynamics With Call-And-Response Rhythms
resources.content:
[{"key":"f117cf18f7c132af","layout":"icon-bullet","attributes":{"body":"
  • To begin to define and use a range of dynamics while playing instruments
  • To play accurate rhythms in time as an ensemble
","title":"What’s achievable","noMargin":false,"image":"https://assets.sparkyard.com/uploads/icons/green-star-1614702483w2iKm.png"}},{"key":"23899d042db91ef1","layout":"icon-bullet","attributes":{"body":"

Large space; untuned percussion instruments

","title":"What you need","noMargin":false,"image":"https://assets.sparkyard.com/uploads/icons/blue-wrench-16147025258WedI.png"}},{"key":"1f6f6afee068734d","layout":"wysiwyg","attributes":{"body":"

Use the lyrical phrases from It’s Good To Be Me! to play some call-and-response rhythms on untuned percussion instruments.

Making sure each child has an instrument, divide them into two groups sitting opposite each other. Using the rhythms from each line of lyrics in the verse, play the instruments to create a rhythmic, call-and-response version of the song (so, group one plays ‘It’s good to be me’ and group two responds with ‘It’s good to know you’ etc.).

Sit the groups a fair distance apart and ask them to play with different dynamics. The ‘response’ group will have to listen carefully to determine whether the ‘call’ is quiet or loud and respond at a similar dynamic.

Finally, divide into three groups assigning group one the chorus rhythm, group two the verse rhythm and group three a steady pulse. Just like the group-singing section of the song, play altogether (first while speaking the lyrics to help with the rhythms, then without). How accurately can the groups play together?

","title":"","noMargin":false}},{"key":"70e730860f4926e2","layout":"icon-bullet","attributes":{"body":"

Get the children working in pairs to create their own call-and-response rhythms with their instruments to perform to the whole class.

","title":"Step It Up!","noMargin":false,"image":"https://assets.sparkyard.com/uploads/icons/u1873-1614695091mFFrP.png"}}]
resources.summary: Play call-and-response rhythms on instruments in groups using different dynamics to develop playing together as an ensemble accurately.

resources.title: Create A ‘Big Picture’ Puzzle
resources.content:
[{"key":"c1f71e821c673445","layout":"wysiwyg","attributes":{"body":"

Create a large puzzle template<\/strong> from stiff cardboard and distribute the different pieces
\nto each child in the class. Get everyone to design and decorate their piece showing exactly what is unique about them. Put the puzzle together to show how they individually fit together in the ‘big picture’.<\/p>\n","title":"","noMargin":false}}]

resources.title: My Unique Tongue Twister
resources.content:
[{"key":"126ff99223c61d28","layout":"wysiwyg","attributes":{"body":"

Get the children to create their own tongue twisters using the first letter of their name. All the words in their sentence should be alliterative such as: Alex always asks about aeroplanes or Molly made a magic monkey.

List all the sentences on a poster to create a tongue-twisting classroom poster and try speaking them all together.

","title":"","noMargin":false}}]

resources.title: Mood Boards
resources.content:
[{"key":"ee75069f28dee1b7","layout":"wysiwyg","attributes":{"body":"

Collect a good supply of colourful magazines and have the children cut out any pictures, words or symbols that represent things they enjoy doing or that they own, places they have been, people they admire, etc. Each child creates a collage with these, writing their name secretly on the back. Then have the rest of the class see if they can guess whose mood board is whose.<\/p>\n","title":"","noMargin":false}}]

resources.title: Singing - The Key Ingredient For A Positive Classroom
resources.privateTitle: Singing - The Key Ingredient For A Positive Classroom
resources.content:
[{"key":"ed22acf395af76c9","layout":"image","attributes":{"image":"https://assets.sparkyard.com/uploads/NewSparks/headerimages/singing-blogheader-v1-16826748769DLs7.png","title":"","noMargin":false}},{"key":"2fb5561497a1a38d","layout":"wysiwyg","attributes":{"body":"

Here at Out of the Ark we have always believed in the power of singing to make a difference and enhance wellbeing. Here are a few of the reasons why...

  • Singing lowers cortisol and produces oxytocin, which relieves stress and tension. It also boosts confidence through the release of endorphins. So, singing makes you happy!
  • Singing is a mindful activity, allowing us to live in the moment.
  • Singing together as a group creates a strong sense of community and togetherness. It also provides an unthreatening way of expressing emotion.
  • The act of learning a new skill, improving and being part of a group also helps to influence your confidence and self-esteem.
  • Singing improves breathing and strengthens the immune system.

We also know that Out of the Ark songs are key ingredients in creating a positive classroom environment, where everyone feels valued. Adding songs to your school day will not only get everyone in the right frame of mind for learning but will boost pupil wellbeing and instil positivity.

Unleash the power of songs in your classroom!

","title":"","noMargin":false}},{"key":"6fe243b364d38405","layout":"title-block","attributes":{"title":"Songs promote self-confidence","background_color":"#6FB843"}},{"key":"7e16c22fece76e54","layout":"wysiwyg","attributes":{"body":"

Songs such as I’m OK! and It’s Good To Be Me! promote self-acceptance and a sense of personal value. Display some of the positive phrases from the songs around the classroom as a healthy reminder.

","title":"","noMargin":false}},{"key":"1a5098f6c575b3bd","layout":"title-block","attributes":{"title":"Songs boost energy!","background_color":"#93699F"}},{"key":"45920363d13f2ce2","layout":"wysiwyg","attributes":{"body":"

A short, sharp burst of singing in the morning eases the transition from home to school and gets everyone ready to embrace the events and challenges of a day. Today Is The Start and Give It All You’ve Got are fabulous feel-good songs, brimming with energy and enthusiasm!  

","title":"","noMargin":false}},{"key":"ce116e0695a83448","layout":"title-block","attributes":{"title":"Songs are motivational!","background_color":"#F5BB26"}},{"key":"309099bbdc7facbe","layout":"wysiwyg","attributes":{"body":"

Setting goals and preparing children for upcoming challenges is part of life, and songs can teach children about the power of perseverance. Every Journey and If You Can Walk, You Can Dance are great ones to try.

","title":"","noMargin":false}},{"key":"47610b4121993e8b","layout":"title-block","attributes":{"title":"Songs promote team spirit ","background_color":"#E15B64"}},{"key":"0a3fa3f9a2e3b3c9","layout":"wysiwyg","attributes":{"body":"

Singing as a group is a social activity, which relies on each individual working with their peers towards a cooperative outcome. Simply singing songs together will help children develop these important skills. To boost the learning further, why not choose songs that highlight the importance of working and getting along together? Life Is Just Like A Song, Different Drums and Ubuntu are perfect choices.

","title":"","noMargin":false}},{"key":"1b46c689e896ff5d","layout":"title-block","attributes":{"title":"Songs inspire mindfulness ","background_color":"#D166C7"}},{"key":"a47896560f3d3bde","layout":"wysiwyg","attributes":{"body":"

Look at this KS2 class having fun creating rhythmic patterns with plastic cups to the instrumental track of Coordination Funk. Their verbal responses at the end of the clip highlight how music-making is a mindful activity, allowing us to live in the moment.

","title":"","noMargin":false}},{"key":"289a7f16e83da3e7","layout":"video","attributes":{"url":"https://vimeo.com/596596360/b457aead95","title":"","noMargin":false}},{"key":"581ea804f41fe0c0","layout":"title-block","attributes":{"title":"Songs are familiar and supportive","background_color":"#15A881"}},{"key":"992f735626f1be73","layout":"wysiwyg","attributes":{"body":"

Songs provide a safe framework where children can explore themes and worries they might be dealing with. Perhaps use them to introduce topics or to support class circle-time activities. Of course, songs are designed to be repeated and messages within songs can be shared again and again. Strengthening connections with home are also possible through the Sparkyard share-link feature. The songbook This is Me is full of songs, poems and activities that support physical and mental wellbeing aspects of the National Curriculum.

","title":"","noMargin":false}},{"key":"12dad84f0051fa90","layout":"title-block","attributes":{"title":"Songs celebrate achievement!","background_color":"#3982BA"}},{"key":"2acab7279de00bc9","layout":"wysiwyg","attributes":{"body":"

Acknowledging class or individual achievement is a great self-esteem booster. Celebrate with a song such as Fiesta or Well Done. Well Done can be sung to an individual child or a group.

","title":"","noMargin":false}},{"key":"2d1d59f481883a69","layout":"title-block","attributes":{"title":"Songs are fun and memorable!","background_color":"#8DC261"}},{"key":"d412a91a3c060519","layout":"wysiwyg","attributes":{"body":"

Songs make us feel good and the joy of school singing and music-making is something that children will remember for the rest of their lives. Laughter IS important, so enjoy singing something silly! Knock, Knock! Who’s There? and Tickled Me Pink! are sure-fire winners.

","title":"","noMargin":false}}]
resources.thumbnailText: Here at Out of the Ark we have always believed in the power of singing to make a difference and enhance wellbeing. Here are a few of the reasons why...

sparkles.title: “LIFE ISN’T ABOUT WAITING FOR THE STORM TO PASS... IT’S ABOUT LEARNING TO DANCE IN THE RAIN.”
